channel.title: poem on ryan jennings

item.title: Poems of Form and Duality
item.description: Love Poem Love is at the mercy of form, Without, may as not be real. Form is merciless, At its peak and as it degrades. Love is a chemical delusion, That is dependent on others, To keep the chemicals flowing. Love is loyalty and trust, Devotion and passion. Skewed by lack, And absenteeism in, A complex world. Love is a great tree, Of family and positivity,
